soft.t1: Time management, Perseverance and Autonomy - UOC
soft.p1:
UOC's methodology is based on delivering projects every X time. Projects demand time and you have to be organized to meet delivery dates. In addition, knowledge of a wide variety of technologies is acquired. 

In summary, after a year at the UOC, I have acquired certain skills, which although they are not technical skills, can be very useful: time management, perseverance, autonomy...
soft.t2: Agile methodologies, Scrum and Teamwork - Bootcamp Fundació Esplai
soft.p2:
Agile methodologies seek to improve the performance of a work group when carrying out a project. For example, using the Scrum framework, the project is divided into small subprojects with short delivery times: the 'sprint'. The result of the subprojects is not the final product, but it must be functional. Scrum also involves the 'daily meeting', the 'scrum master', etc.
 
 In addition to improving teamwork and increasing productivity, it is possible to improve the quality of the product and the customer experience by increasing the level of adaptation to unforeseen events or unexpected changes in customer requirements.
 
 The final project of the Fundació Esplai's bootcamp, with a duration of about 3-4 weeks, has been carried out in groups of 3 people using Scrum.
